intro: Aglaia somalensis, commonly known as the Somali aglaia, is a flowering plant native to the Horn of Africa. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes species known for their medicinal properties. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. It typically grows in dry, open habitats and is often found in coastal areas. Its fruit is a capsule that releases small, winged seeds, facilitating wind dispersal.
